metadata.feature_description: Bookmark and unbookmark articles for later reference

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki article page (Tag Test Article - Single Tag)
steps.expected: Article page loads with 'Bookmark this' button visible
steps.actual: Article page loaded with 'Bookmark this' link and three action icons (Like, Bookmark, Subscribe)

steps.expected: Button changes to 'Remove bookmark' and bookmark count increases
steps.actual: Button changed to 'Remove bookmark' and Bookmarks count in sidebar increased from (2) to (3)

steps.action: Click 'Remove bookmark' button on bookmarked article
steps.expected: Button changes back to 'Bookmark this' and bookmark count decreases
steps.actual: Button changed back to 'Bookmark this' and Bookmarks count in sidebar decreased from (3) to (2)

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki page and locate Bookmarks section in sidebar
steps.expected: Bookmarks section displays with count of bookmarked articles
steps.actual: Bookmarks (2) displayed in sidebar showing correct count of bookmarked articles

steps.action: Bookmark an article and refresh the page
steps.expected: Bookmark status should persist after page refresh
steps.actual: After page refresh, the article still shows 'Remove bookmark' button and Bookmarks count remains at (3), confirming bookmark persisted in database

observations: Bookmark scoring points: Code review shows BookmarkedArticle scoring action has 0 default points (Mechanics.cs line 56)

The Bookmarks section in the sidebar displays the count but clicking it does not expand to show a detailed list of bookmarked articles - it appears to be a collapsible panel or the list may be available through the user profile/Activity Feed
The bookmark toggle button (Like/Bookmark/Subscribe icons) updates via AJAX without full page reload
The Social Library integration handles the actual bookmark storage as confirmed in SocialController.cs
